result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant Angelina Renee Martin in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Angelina Renee Martin.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Through Counsel DEF enters NG Plea to Count 2.  Bond Continues.  Through Attorney DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing and be set for Status Conference.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:27 AM  DE Angelina Renee Martin in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500 No Contact with N.R.B.  dob: 11/9/2006  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for August 2, 2022 at 8:30AM.
